sen.j: 九条 道孝（くじょう みちたか、天保10年5月1日 (旧暦)（1839年6月11日）- 明治39年（1906年）1月4日）は、幕末期の公卿。
sen.e: Michitaka KUJO (June 11, 1839-January 4, 1906) was Kugyo in the end of the Edo period.

sen.j: 明治時代の政治家。
sen.e: He was a politician in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 従一位公爵、貴族院議員。
sen.e: He was Prince in Junior First Rank and a member of Kizokuin (the House of Peers).

sen.j: 当初は道隆とも表記した。
sen.e: At first, his name Michitaka (道孝) was also written in another Chinese letters as 道隆.

sen.j: 父は九条尚忠（道孝は長男）、養父は九条幸経（尚忠の養嗣子）。
sen.e: His father was Hisatada KUJO (Michitaka was his eldest son) and his foster father was Yukitsune KUJO (an adoptive heir of Hisatada).

sen.j: 孝明天皇の女御・英照皇太后は姉。
sen.e: The Empress Dowager Eisho who was nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court [a consort of an emperor]) of the Emperor Komei was his sister.
Empress Dowager Eisho who was nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court [a consort of an emperor]) of Emperor Komei was his elder sister.

sen.j: 娘の節子は大正天皇の皇后（貞明皇后）となった。
sen.e: His daughter Setsuko was the empress of the Emperor Taisho (the Empress Teimei).

sen.cmt: 冠詞削除、大文字化しました。

sen.j: 昭和天皇の母方の祖父。
sen.e: He was the maternal grandfather of the Emperor Showa.

sen.j: 最後の藤氏長者であった。
sen.e: He was the last Toshi choja (head of the Fujiwara clan).

sen.j: 九条尚忠の長男だったが、九条幸経の養嗣子となった。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of Hisatada KUJO, but was adopted as a heir of Yukitsune KUJO.

sen.j: 1864年、国事御用掛、1867年には左大臣となる。
sen.e: He was assigned to Kokuji goyogakari (a general official of the Imperial Household in charge of the State affair) in 1864 and Sadaijin (minister of the left) in 1867.

sen.j: 大政奉還前は、父の尚忠と同じく幕府との協調を推進。
sen.e: Before Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor), he promoted cooperation with bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) as well as his father Hisatada.
Before Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor), he promoted cooperation with bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) as his father Hisatada did.

sen.j: そのことから、王政復古の大号令が出された時は、それを追及されて参内停止処分に処せられた。
sen.e: By this reason, he was punished with the prohibition on entering Imperial Palace when the Decree (of 1867) for the Restoration of Imperial Rule was announced.

sen.j: が、1868年に許され処分を解かれた。
sen.e: However, he was allowed in 1868.

sen.e: In the same year, he was appointed to Toshi choja (the last choja) after abolishment of Sessho Kanpaku (regent and chief adviser to the Emperor) and assigned to Ou Chinbu-sotoku (the general of placating Ou).

sen.j: 戊辰戦争では東北地方を転戦した。

sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, he was in charge of an adviser of the Emperor Meiji.
